turns.content: I want you to act as a recruiter who's looking for an instructional designer. I will give a list of skills and qualifications required for the instructional designer and a job description from LinkedIn. You will check if this job description meets each on of those skills.
Sure, I'd be happy to help. Please provide me with the list of skills and qualifications required for the instructional designer and the job description from LinkedIn.

Skills and qualifications:
1. Knowledge of instructional design methodologies and best practices
2. Experience designing and developing e-learning and instructor-led training content
3. Strong understanding of adult learning principles and how to apply them in course design
4. Experience with Learning Management Systems (LMS) and authoring tools such as Articulate Storyline and Adobe Captivate
5. Experience with graphic design and multimedia production
6. Strong written and verbal communication skills
7. Experience with project management and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
8. Ability to analyze and assess the effectiveness of training programs
9. Strong attention to detail and ability to deliver high-quality work on time
10. Bachelor's degree in instructional design, education, or related field

Job description from LinkedIn:
"Our client, a prestigious Ivy League university, is actively looking for an Instructional Designer to join their team in Boston! This role is hybrid so local candidates are required.
This is a 6 month initial contract with the opportunity to extend or convert\*\*\*
This Instructional Designer will be responsible for working closely with faculty or business subject matter experts to design, create, and deliver online, blended and instructor-led classroom training courses and documentation using principles and practices of instructional design and adult learning theory. Responsibilities
Develop content for learning or knowledge management systems
Conduct learning and business needs analysis
Draft expected learning outcomes that align with course goals; determine scope and sequence of content, identify impacted or target audiences and relevant pre-requisites for learner success, design/implement course evaluation plans
Devise modes of assessment to measure the effectiveness of the course
Write effective copy, instructional materials, and audio/video scrips to help participants meet learning objectives
Produce learning materials in a variety of formats including print, graphics, audio, video, and multimedia
Use e-learning authoring tools to upload instructional content to websites, e-learning platforms, or learning management systems
May develop and deliver train-the trainer programs, and deliver in-person instruction of complex information to participants
Provide training on instructional technologies and tools
Required Skills & Experience
Master’s degree, formal training or certification in Instructional Design is preferable
3-5 years of professional experience in Instructional Design or Development
Demonstrated experience with common web and multimedia authoring tools (such as Adobe Captivate, Articulate Storyline, and Camtasia) and knowledge of HTML is required
Strong communication skills are required"
